original_value: Solel Boneh built roads, housing, and utilities in Mandate Palestine and the Negev, laying groundwork for later settlement and ecological impact.
notes: Foundational infrastructure provider in Mandate era

original_value: Built settlement housing and arterial roads (e.g., Ma'ale Adumim, Ariel, Modi'in Illit; Road 60/90) consolidating Israeli control and fragmenting ecosystems.
notes: Major builder for settlements and roads

original_value: Continued large projects through Oslo era, expanding road and housing links that entrenched settlement blocs.
notes: Continuity of settlement expansion into Oslo period

original_value: Constructed Green Line sections connecting Israeli settlement neighborhoods across East Jerusalem, expropriating Palestinian land.

original_value: Ongoing Green Line construction linking settlement blocs during and after 2023 escalation.

original_value: Built IMOD ICT campus (2018), Intelligence campus (2020), and Gaza technological barrier segments (2019) via PPP contracts.

original_value: Ongoing PPP operation of national police training complex.

original_value: Solar farms and energy parks in Naqab, Syrian Golan, and West Bank on confiscated land displacing Palestinians and Bedouins.

original_value: Continuation of solar and industrial energy projects on expropriated lands.

original_value: Ongoing operation of power and industrial assets in Neot Hovav near Bedouin communities.

original_value: Provision of IP-based Unified Communications (voice, video, data) systems to Israeli military units, centralizing networks and accelerating response times.
notes: Digital backbone for military coordination and surveillance

original_value: Networking, cybersecurity, and load-balancing systems integrated into Israel’s underground Naqab ICT military data center ('David’s Citadel'), centralizing many surveillance and intelligence systems.
notes: Critical ICT hub for long-term military consolidation in the Naqab

original_value: Supported development of the 'Israel Rises' digital platform for the Home Front Command during the October 2023 offensive in Gaza.
notes: Civil–military platform used during the 2023 assault

original_value: Won tender to supply high-capacity servers (NIS ~1 billion) to the Israeli military; servers integrated by a local contractor and funded via US aid.
notes: High-capacity servers powering military surveillance and operational data

original_value: Partnered on the 'Klika' program to launch tech hubs (45 hubs total); several hubs were placed in West Bank and Golan settlements, embedding Cisco equipment in occupied localities.
notes: Tech-enabled industrialization of occupied/settlement areas

original_value: Installed communications systems and CCTV as part of a Jerusalem 'Smart City' pilot, enhancing municipal surveillance capacities that disproportionately affect Palestinian neighborhoods.
notes: Smart City surveillance reinforcing spatial control in Jerusalem

original_value: Supplied Nituv routing and related communications equipment purchased by the Israeli police (2020–2021), strengthening police communications and operational capacity.
notes: Reinforces repressive policing infrastructure

original_value: Acquired land from absentee landowners; evicted Palestinian tenant farmers; laid foundations for exclusive Jewish settlement before 1948.
notes: Colonial land purchase and eviction strategy; JNF constitution reserves land for Jewish use.

original_value: Post-Nakba consolidation of expropriated refugee lands under state/JNF control; continued exclusionary land regime.
notes: Continuation of dispossession after 1948; JNF land cannot be leased/sold to non-Jews.

original_value: Planted ~1.7 million European pine/eucalyptus trees (by 1935), replacing indigenous olive/carob/pistachio and altering ecosystems.
notes: Exotic conifers increase acidity, reduce understory, heighten flammability; ecological disruption during Mandate era.

original_value: Forests and parks planted over razed villages (e.g., Ajjur, Zakariyya) to conceal expulsions and block return.
notes: Trees used as a tool to fix dispossession post-Nakba.

original_value: Continuation of forestation/parks masking depopulated localities; tactic to prevent return and recast heritage.
notes: Long-run maintenance/expansion of forest covers.

original_value: Oslo-era continuation of forestation as green cover for dispossession.
notes: ‘Peace’ frame while maintaining erasure of village sites.

original_value: Blockade-era persistence of forest/park overlays on destroyed villages.

original_value: Post-2023 continuation of park/forest maintenance over erased localities.

original_value: Canada Park built over villages Imwas and Yalo after 1967; marketed as ‘in Israel’ despite West Bank location.
notes: Foreign-funded park entrenching erasure of depopulated villages.

original_value: $600m, 10-year program (afforestation, reservoirs, water projects) facilitating displacement of ~150,000 Bedouin in the Naqab.

original_value: Continuation of Naqab green/industrial projects that pressure displacement.

original_value: D9 bulldozers supplied to Israeli military since 1960s, extensively used in demolitions and invasions in the West Bank and Gaza.

original_value: Lavender flagged ~37,000 Palestinians as 'suspected militants' with minimal human oversight; outputs used as kill lists for Gaza airstrikes, normalizing mass civilian casualties.
notes: AI-enabled targeting treated as human-approved decisions, embedding automated ecocide in war conduct.

original_value: Azure cloud used to store and process Palestinian phone metadata for Unit 8200; petabyte-scale processing (11,500 TB annually) before 2023 escalation.
notes: Corporate cloud infrastructure embedded in occupation’s surveillance regime.

original_value: Azure systems enabled Unit 8200 to process millions of intercepted Palestinian calls daily during Gaza invasion; data informed mass targeting, detentions, and killings.
notes: Cloud backbone for AI-driven surveillance and lethal operations, under scrutiny post-2023.
